queries.description: Privileged containers lack essential security restrictions and should be avoided by removing the 'privileged' flag or by changing its value to false
Containers should not have CAP_SYS_ADMIN Linux capability

files.expected_value: spec.template.spec.containers.name=loxilb-app should not use CAP_SYS_ADMIN Linux capability
spec.template.spec.containers.name=loxilb-peer-app should not use CAP_SYS_ADMIN Linux capability

queries.description: Containers should not run with allowPrivilegeEscalation in order to prevent them from gaining more privileges than their parent process

files.expected_value: metadata.name={{kube-loxilb}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{kube-loxilb}}.securityContext.allowPrivilegeEscalation should be set and should be set to false
metadata.name={{loxilb-lb}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{loxilb-app}}.securityContext.allowPrivilegeEscalation should be set and should be set to false
metadata.name={{loxilb-peer}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{loxilb-peer-app}}.securityContext.allowPrivilegeEscalation should be set and should be set to false

queries.description: Containers should only run as non-root user. This limits the exploitability of security misconfigurations and restricts an attacker's possibilities in case of compromise

files.expected_value: metadata.name={{loxilb-lb}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{loxilb-app}}.securityContext.runAsUser is higher than 0 and/or 'runAsNonRoot' is true
metadata.name={{loxilb-peer}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{loxilb-peer-app}}.securityContext.runAsUser is higher than 0 and/or 'runAsNonRoot' is true
metadata.name={{kube-loxilb}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{kube-loxilb}}.securityContext.runAsUser is higher than 0 and/or 'runAsNonRoot' is true

queries.description: Check if containers are running with low UID, which might cause conflicts with the host's user table.
Containers should not have extra capabilities allowed

files.expected_value: metadata.name={{kube-loxilb}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{kube-loxilb}} has no capability added other than NET_BIND_SERVICE
files.actual_value: metadata.name={{kube-loxilb}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{kube-loxilb}} has a capability added other than NET_BIND_SERVICE

files.expected_value: metadata.name={{loxilb-lb}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{loxilb-app}} has no capability added other than NET_BIND_SERVICE
files.actual_value: metadata.name={{loxilb-lb}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{loxilb-app}} has a capability added other than NET_BIND_SERVICE

files.expected_value: metadata.name={{loxilb-peer}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{loxilb-peer-app}} has no capability added other than NET_BIND_SERVICE
files.actual_value: metadata.name={{loxilb-peer}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{loxilb-peer-app}} has a capability added other than NET_BIND_SERVICE

queries.description: Memory limits should be defined for each container. This prevents potential resource exhaustion by ensuring that containers consume not more than the designated amount of memory
Memory requests should be defined for each container. This allows the kubelet to reserve the requested amount of system resources and prevents over-provisioning on individual nodes
Containers should drop 'ALL' or at least 'NET_RAW' capabilities
Check if Readiness Probe is not configured.
Containers should be configured with a secure Seccomp profile to restrict potentially dangerous syscalls

queries.query_name: Service Account Token Automount Not Disabled
queries.description: Service Account Tokens are automatically mounted even if not necessary

files.expected_value: metadata.name={{loxilb-peer}}.spec.template.spec.automountServiceAccountToken should be defined and set to false
metadata.name={{loxilb-lb}}.spec.template.spec.automountServiceAccountToken should be defined and set to false
metadata.name={{kube-loxilb}}.spec.template.spec.automountServiceAccountToken should be defined and set to false

queries.description: Container should not share the host network namespace

files.expected_value: 'spec.template.spec.hostNetwork' should be set to false or undefined
'spec.template.spec.hostNetwork' should be set to false or undefined
'spec.template.spec.hostNetwork' should be set to false or undefined

queries.description: Namespaces like 'default', 'kube-system' or 'kube-public' should not be used

files.expected_value: 'metadata.namespace' should not be set to default, kube-system or kube-public
'metadata.namespace' should not be set to default, kube-system or kube-public
'metadata.namespace' should not be set to default, kube-system or kube-public
'metadata.namespace' should not be set to default, kube-system or kube-public
'metadata.namespace' should not be set to default, kube-system or kube-public
'metadata.namespace' should not be set to default, kube-system or kube-public

queries.description: CPU limits should be set because if the system has CPU time free, a container is guaranteed to be allocated as much CPU as it requests
CPU requests should be set to ensure the sum of the resource requests of the scheduled Containers is less than the capacity of the node
Image tag must be defined and not be empty or equal to latest.

files.expected_value: metadata.name={{loxilb-lb}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{loxilb-app}}.image tag is provided and not latest
files.actual_value: metadata.name={{loxilb-lb}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{loxilb-app}}.image tag is not provided or latest

files.expected_value: metadata.name={{loxilb-peer}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{loxilb-peer-app}}.image tag is provided and not latest
files.actual_value: metadata.name={{loxilb-peer}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{loxilb-peer-app}}.image tag is not provided or latest

files.expected_value: metadata.name={{kube-loxilb}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{kube-loxilb}}.image tag is provided and not latest
files.actual_value: metadata.name={{kube-loxilb}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{kube-loxilb}}.image tag is not provided or latest

queries.description: Containers should be configured with an AppArmor profile to enforce fine-grained access control over low-level system resources

files.expected_value: metadata.name={{kube-loxilb}}.spec.template.metadata.annotations should specify an AppArmor profile for container {{kube-loxilb}}
files.actual_value: metadata.name={{kube-loxilb}}.spec.template.metadata.annotations does not specify an AppArmor profile for container {{kube-loxilb}}

files.expected_value: metadata.name={{loxilb-lb}}.spec.template.metadata.annotations should specify an AppArmor profile for container {{loxilb-app}}
files.actual_value: metadata.name={{loxilb-lb}}.spec.template.metadata.annotations does not specify an AppArmor profile for container {{loxilb-app}}

files.expected_value: metadata.name={{loxilb-peer}}.spec.template.metadata.annotations should specify an AppArmor profile for container {{loxilb-peer-app}}
files.actual_value: metadata.name={{loxilb-peer}}.spec.template.metadata.annotations does not specify an AppArmor profile for container {{loxilb-peer-app}}

queries.description: Sees if Kubernetes Drop Capabilities exists to ensure containers security context
Each namespace should have a LimitRange policy associated to ensure that resource allocations of Pods, Containers and PersistentVolumeClaims do not exceed the defined boundaries

files.actual_value: metadata.name={{loxilb-lb}} does not have a 'LimitRange' policy associated
metadata.name={{loxilb-peer}} does not have a 'LimitRange' policy associated
metadata.name={{kube-loxilb}} does not have a 'LimitRange' policy associated

queries.description: Each namespace should have a ResourceQuota policy associated to limit the total amount of resources Pods, Containers and PersistentVolumeClaims can consume

files.actual_value: metadata.name={{kube-loxilb}} does not have a 'ResourceQuota' policy associated
metadata.name={{loxilb-lb}} does not have a 'ResourceQuota' policy associated
metadata.name={{loxilb-peer}} does not have a 'ResourceQuota' policy associated

queries.description: Check if the root container filesystem is not being mounted read-only.
